Text

[The Unwanted Marriage DION & FAYEâ€ ™ S STORY

THE WINDSORS BOOK]108-the unwanted marriage dion & fayeâ€ ™ s story the windsors book THREE

CATHARINA MAURA

This one is for those of [us]109-us that let life pass [us]109-us by under the guise of doing the right thing . Keep making those difficult choices that [you]110-you know [you]110-you must , until [your]110-you waking hours are better than [your]110-you sweetest dreams .

Trigger Warning

This book contains sensitive themes , including but not limited to domestic violence in [the female main characterâ€ ™ s home]111-the female main characterâ€ ™ s home ( none between [Dion]33-dion and [Faye]33-dion ) and parental loss .

Even though retribution and a happily ever after ending are guaranteed , reader discretion is advised .

Chapter One

Dion

When [[my]0-i grandmother]112-my grandmother asked [[my]0-i siblings]113-my siblings and [me]0-i to gather in [[our]109-us formal drawing room]114-our formal drawing room , [I]0-i ’d known . [I]0-i had n’t wanted to admit it to [myself]0-i , but [I]0-i ’d known that [my]0-i time was up . [Grandma]34-grandma ’s eyes roam over [the room]115-the room , and while [she]34-grandma studies [[my]0-i four brothers]116-my four brothers and [[my]0-i little sister]117-my little sister , [I]0-i study [her]34-grandma . [I]0-i take in [her]34-grandma perfectly styled shoulder - length hair , the blue suit [she]34-grandma ’s wearing , and the sheer uncompromising ruthlessness in [her]34-grandma demeanor . There ’s no kindness in [her]34-grandma gaze today . [I]0-i tense when [she]34-grandma clears [her]34-grandma throat , [my]0-i stomach sinking the moment those cold green eyes settle on [me]0-i . [I]0-i knew what [she]34-grandma ’d say before [she]34-grandma even parted [her]34-grandma lips , but that does n’t lessen the weight of [her]34-grandma words . “ [Dion]33-dion , [your]33-dion wedding date has been set , ”[34-grandma] [she]34-grandma announces , [her]34-grandma tone carrying a finality that [I]0-i struggle to come to terms with . “ The wedding will be held six months from now . ”[34-grandma] The tension in [the room]115-the room is palpable , the air laced with defeat . “ [I]0-i see , ”[0-i] [I]0-i murmur , unable to keep [my]0-i voice steady . [My]0-i usual mask of indifference fails [me]0-i tonight , and [I]0-i lower [my]0-i gaze , unwilling to worry [[my]0-i siblings]113-my siblings needlessly . Arranged marriages are a Windsor tradition , and [I]0-i ’ve known for years that this day would come . Out of all [[my]0-i siblings]113-my siblings , [I]0-i ’m [the only one who ’s been engaged for years]121-the only one who ’s been engaged for years , [the only one who ’s known who [I]0-i ’d marry]122-the only one who ’s known who i ’d marry for over a decade now . That never made it easier . No — if anything , it ’s felt like a slow walk toward the gallows , until , at last , [my]0-i fate is sealed . [[My]0-i grandmother]112-my grandmother begins to discuss wedding plans , details , and timelines , but [I]0-i struggle to focus on [her]112-my grandmother words . All [I]0-i can think about is [Faye]33-dion , [[my]0-i fiancée]124-my fiancée . Thoughts of [her]124-my fiancée are always accompanied by remorse , and today is no different . Remorse for everything [I]0-i ’ve taken from [her]124-my fiancée , and everything [I]0-i ’m yet to destroy . [She]124-my fiancée should ’ve had [her]124-my fiancée entire life ahead of [her]124-my fiancée , but instead , [I]0-i ’ll ruin what ’s left of [her]124-my fiancée . “ [Dion]33-dion ? ”[112-my grandmother] [[my]0-i grandmother]112-my grandmother says , cutting through the haze . [My]0-i eyes snap up , and [I]0-i realize [the room]115-the room has fallen silent . “ Need [I]0-i remind [you]33-dion of [our]127-our agreement ? It ’s time to stop avoiding [Faye]33-dion . ”[0-i] [I]0-i clench [my]0-i jaw and nod curtly . [Faye]33-dion and [I]0-i have been engaged since [we]127-our were [children]128-children , but [I]0-i was n’t informed of it until [I]0-i was sixteen . The second [I]0-i could , [I]0-i escaped to [boarding school]129-boarding school , followed by college overseas . The idea of marrying someone ten years younger horrified [me]0-i , but even then , there was more to it . It was the fact that it was [her]112-my grandmother . [I]0-i kept running , choosing to focus on the global expansion of [[our]127-our conglomerate]130-our conglomerate after college , just so [I]0-i did n’t have to face [her]112-my grandmother more than a few times a year . Working overseas bought [me]0-i a bit more time , but it was n’t enough . It ’ll never be enough . [[My]0-i grandmother]112-my grandmother continues to speak , but [I]0-i ca n’t take another moment of this . Before [I]0-i realize what [I]0-i ’m doing , [I]0-i ’m out the door and halfway through [[our]127-our estate]132-our estate , [my]0-i thoughts whirling . [I]0-i keep walking , needing the fresh air , the chill in the wind — anything to keep [my]0-i mind off [Faye]33-dion . [I]0-i ’m so caught up in [my]0-i thoughts that [I]0-i had n’t been fully aware of where [my]0-i feet led [me]0-i . [My]0-i heart twists painfully as [I]0-i pause in front of [a familiar building]133-a familiar building , the sharp pain a welcome deviation from the numbness that had overtaken [me]0-i when [I]0-i left [the drawing room]134-the drawing room . [I]0-i had n’t meant to come here , but there is obviously no escaping [my]0-i guilt tonight . [My]0-i fingers gently brush over the hidden compartment in the wall , and [I]0-i push against one of the bricks , exposing a spare key . [[Our]135-we childhood home]136-our childhood home is [the only building on [[our]135-we estate]132-our estate]137-the only building on our estate that [we]135-we never upgraded with the new tech [we]135-we installed everywhere else . Though [we]135-we never discussed [it]136-our childhood home , [[my]0-i siblings]113-my siblings and [I]0-i came to a silent agreement to leave [it]136-our childhood home untouched . Perhaps [we]135-we all simply wanted to preserve what ’s left of [[our]135-we parents]140-our parents , or maybe [none of [us]135-we]141-none of us are quite ready to let go . [I]0-i ’m not sure [we]135-we ever will be . [The house]142-the house is quiet when [I]0-i walk in , and though [it]142-the house looks the same as [I]0-i remember [it]142-the house , it feels different . [This home]143-this home , that was once filled with warmth , feels empty , and it hits [me]0-i just as hard as it did twenty years ago . Somehow , a small part of [me]0-i expected [[my]0-i mother]144-my mother to walk down the stairs , a sweet smile on [her]144-my mother face as [she]144-my mother welcomes [me]0-i [home]145-home . Knowing [I]0-i ’ll never get to see [her]144-my mother again still hurts the same . More so today than usual . [I]0-i draw a shaky breath , and [my]0-i lungs seize as [I]0-i try to breathe through the dull pain in [my]0-i chest . [I]0-i ’d give [the world]146-the world to have [[my]0-i parents]147-my parents here with [me]0-i today , and knowing that nothing [I]0-i could ever do will bring [them]147-my parents back tears at [my]0-i tattered soul . [I]0-i pause in front of [[my]0-i father]148-my father ’s liquor cabinet and let [myself]0-i wonder what it ’d be like to share a glass with [him]148-my father . What advice would [he]148-my father have for [me]0-i tonight ? [He]148-my father adored [Faye]33-dion when [she]149-she was [a child]150-a child , and [I]0-i doubt that would ’ve changed . [My]0-i hand trembles as [I]0-i grab a bottle of [his]148-my father finest whiskey and bring it to [my]0-i lips . The liquor warms [my]0-i throat , and [I]0-i welcome the feeling as [I]0-i continue to walk through [the house]142-the house , until [my]0-i feet come to a standstill in front of [[my]0-i mother]144-my mother ’s piano . [I]0-i stand frozen in place , [my]0-i heart hollow . [The concert grand]153-the concert grand was custom - built for [her]144-my mother , right down to the Windsor crest detailing in real gold on the top board , and the rosewood finishing that [she]144-my mother let [me]0-i choose . It ’s a beauty fit for [the queen]154-the queen [she]144-my mother was , and [I]0-i ’d give [the world]146-the world to hear [her]144-my mother play for [me]0-i one last time . [I]0-i ’d lay down [my]0-i life to see one more smile . [I]0-i take several more deep swigs of [[my]0-i father]148-my father ’s whiskey , and for a brief moment , [I]0-i wonder what [Mom]35-mom would think if [she]35-mom saw [me]0-i now . Would [she]35-mom be disappointed that [I]0-i stopped playing the piano ? Once again , [my]0-i thoughts turn to [Faye]33-dion , and [I]0-i take another step forward . [[My]0-i mother]144-my mother would ’ve loved [the woman [Faye]33-dion]158-the woman faye has become , even if it ’s just because [she]158-the woman faye ’s [a concert pianist]159-a concert pianist , just like both of [[our]160-our mothers]161-our mothers were . [Mom]35-mom would ’ve asked to play duets with [her]158-the woman faye in [this room]162-this room , and [they]163-they ’d never run out of things to talk about . [She]35-mom ’d tell [Faye]33-dion all about how [she]35-mom once taught [me]0-i to play , and how [she]35-mom wanted [me]0-i to follow in [her]35-mom footsteps . If [I]0-i had n’t lost [her]35-mom , would [I]0-i have ? [I]0-i sit down on [[my]0-i mother]144-my mother ’s piano bench , the sheet music untouched . [La Campanella]1-la campanella . [Her]144-my mother favorite . [She]35-mom did n’t even need to read the notes to play it — the sheet music was for [me]0-i . It ’s the last piece [she]35-mom tried teaching [me]0-i , and one of the few [I]0-i never had the heart to master . Not truly . [I]0-i lightly brush [my]0-i fingers over the ivories , [my]0-i heart heavy . “ [I]0-i miss [you]35-mom , ”[0-i] [I]0-i whisper , desperate for a reply . When none comes , [I]0-i lift [[my]0-i father]148-my father ’s bottle to [my]0-i lips again , drinking deeply . Desperation dictates [my]0-i moves as [I]0-i place the bottle by [my]0-i feet and begin to play , the melody starting off slow . [My]0-i eyes move across the notes , and for a moment , [I]0-i remember why [I]0-i loved playing so much , back when the sound of a piano did n’t rip [my]0-i heart to pieces , back when it was [our]166-our thing — [Mom]35-mom and [mine]0-i . The song is distorted , ruined by the piano ’s need for tuning , but somehow , it suits [my]0-i mood far better than the normally light and uplifting tilt of [Liszt]36-liszt ’s famous tune . It sounds as broken as [I]0-i am , and the notes [I]0-i miss would ’ve made [[my]0-i mother]144-my mother cringe . [She]144-my mother ’d have flinched at the way [I]0-i ’m butchering [her]144-my mother favorite piece , the way [her]144-my mother piano sounds due to [my]0-i negligence , and then [she]144-my mother ’d have pasted on a bright reassuring smile , because that ’s who [she]144-my mother was . [She]144-my mother was warmth , love , and the light in [my]0-i life . [[My]0-i world]168-my world has been cast in shadows since the day [I]0-i lost [[my]0-i parents]147-my parents , and [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i ’ll ever claw [my]0-i way out . The melody turns darker , rougher , the acoustics of [this room]162-this room still as perfect as they ’ve always been , but it does nothing to soothe [my]0-i aching heart . The final note echoes , and [I]0-i exhale shakily as [I]0-i rest [my]0-i forehead against the music shelf . “ [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i ’d hear [you]171-my sister play again . ”[0-i] [I]0-i tense and turn [my]0-i head to find [[my]0-i sister]171-my sister standing in the doorway , [her]171-my sister expression as haunted as [mine]0-i likely is . How did [she]171-my sister know where to find [me]0-i ? [I]0-i shake the thought off and smile wryly . No , of course [she]171-my sister knew . [Sierra]37-sierra and [I]0-i are made of the same ilk . [She]171-my sister shines brightly , the way [Mom]35-mom always did , but behind [her]171-my sister smile hides a depth most ca n’t fathom . Out of [all of [us]172-all of us]172-all of us , [she]171-my sister ’s the most observant , the most caring . [She]171-my sister feels things deeply , both highs and lows , and [she]171-my sister hurts alongside [every one of [[our]172-all of us siblings]174-our siblings]173-every one of our siblings . Tonight might be hard for [me]0-i , but witnessing [my]0-i pain will break [her]171-my sister heart more than it does [mine]0-i . [I]0-i know [I]0-i should fake it for [her]171-my sister and be [the big brother [she]171-my sister deserves]175-the big brother she deserves , but [I]0-i ca n’t . Not tonight . [She]171-my sister walks toward [me]0-i and kneels beside [my]0-i bench , a shaky smile on [her]171-my sister lips . Not [her]171-my sister . ”[37-sierra] [Sierra]37-sierra pulls away to look at [me]0-i , [her]171-my sister expression guarded . “ But [you]0-i must , and if it ’s absolution [you]0-i seek , what better way to find it than by making [Faye]33-dion happy ? [You]0-i deserve to be happy . ”[37-sierra] [I]0-i look into [[my]0-i sister]171-my sister ’s eyes , taking in [her]171-my sister sincerity . Chapter Two

[Faye]33-dion

[My]0-i back is perfectly straight as [I]0-i raise a fork to [my]0-i lips , the slight tremor in [my]0-i hand betraying the dread that ’s taking root deep in [my]0-i gut . [I]0-i tighten [my]0-i grip on the metal , willing [myself]0-i to stay calm as [I]0-i chew on [my]0-i tasteless poached eggs . [We]180-we ’re all just waiting for it — waiting for [Father]38-father to snap at [us]180-we over something . Will it be the food today ? Perhaps [he]38-father ’ll think [we]180-we ’re chewing too loudly . Whatever it is , something is bound to give . Normally , [he]38-father ’d already have left for work by now , and the fact [he]38-father has n’t does not bode well for [any of [us]180-we]181-any of us . [[My]0-i stepmother]182-my stepmother , [Abigail]39-abigail , carries the same expression that [I]0-i undoubtedly do . It ’s fake pleasantness born from fear . [We]180-we ’re both eerily calm , having learned the hard way that any other behavior will set [[my]0-i father]148-my father off . [I]0-i control [my]0-i breathing and focus on swallowing [my]0-i food . [I]0-i wo n’t let [him]38-father catch [me]0-i wasting a single bite , no matter how close [I]0-i am to throwing up . [My]0-i anxiety continues to rise as [[my]0-i two younger half - sisters]184-my two younger half - sisters , [Linda]40-linda and [Chloe]41-chloe , squirm in [their]184-my two younger half - sisters seats . With each passing second , [I]0-i can see [[my]0-i father]148-my father ’s annoyance build . Please , [I]0-i silently beg . Please do n’t let [them]184-my two younger half - sisters be punished for [their]184-my two younger half - sisters restlessness . [I]0-i ’m equal parts glad and fearful that [[my]0-i two younger step - sisters]186-my two younger step - sisters have n’t had to learn how to adjust [their]186-my two younger step - sisters behavior to [[our]187-our father]188-our father . It means there ’s still hope for [them]186-my two younger step - sisters , that [their]186-my two younger step - sisters spirits are n’t quite broken just yet — but it also means [his]148-my father actions hurt [them]186-my two younger step - sisters more than [they]186-my two younger step - sisters do [me]0-i . [I]0-i ’ve become used to it now , but [I]0-i hope [they]186-my two younger step - sisters ’ll never have to . Not much longer now . Just a few more months , and things will finally get better . “ [Linda]40-linda , ”[38-father] [Father]38-father says , and [she]189-she tenses . For a split - second , dread flashes through [[my]0-i sister]171-my sister ’s eyes , but then [she]189-she controls it , pasting on the smile [we]187-our ’ve all perfected . So far , [he]148-my father has n’t hurt [the girls]191-the girls , but how much longer can [I]0-i protect [them]191-the girls ? “ Yes , [Father]38-father ? ”[148-my father] “ When do [you]148-my father leave for college ? ”[148-my father] A pang of longing settles deep in [my]0-i chest , and [I]0-i take a shaky breath . [I]0-i only just graduated , but unlike [[my]0-i younger sister]192-my younger sister , [I]0-i was never allowed to live on [campus]193-campus . [I]0-i do n’t begrudge [her]192-my younger sister the experience , but a small part of [me]0-i wishes [I]0-i could ’ve had that too . “ Three weeks from now , ”[192-my younger sister] [she]192-my younger sister answers , [her]192-my younger sister voice soft , sweet . [Linda]40-linda has so many choices ahead of [her]40-linda , and [I]0-i wonder if [she]40-linda realizes what a luxury that is . [[My]0-i sister]171-my sister will get to choose [her]171-my sister own major , [[her]171-my sister friends]195-her friends . [She]171-my sister ’ll leave [[our]196-our father]188-our father ’s clutches and escape into [a world that will let [her]171-my sister shape [her]171-my sister own future]198-a world that will let her shape her own future — it ’s everything [I]0-i ’ve ever wanted for [her]171-my sister . [I]0-i wonder what it might be like to discover [your]199-your own interests , the way [she]171-my sister will . Chapter Six

[Faye]33-dion

[I]0-i stand behind the curtain on stage and stare at [the packed room]336-the packed room , [my]0-i sorrow weighing heavy on [me]0-i . Every time [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’m okay , something reminds [me]0-i of [Eric]44-eric , and [my]0-i heart breaks all over again . It ’s been nearly two weeks since [I]0-i ended things with [him]335-him , and true to [my]0-i word , [I]0-i have n’t spoken to [him]335-him since . [I]0-i ’m terrified of what [he]335-him might do if [I]0-i were to speak to [Eric]44-eric . [The perfect daughter]341-the perfect daughter , [the perfect Windsor wife]342-the perfect windsor wife . Being with [Eric]44-eric felt freeing , and that feeling was addictive . [I]0-i ’m not sure how to hold on without those little moments between [us]343-us that felt real in a world that ’s designed to deceive . In the weeks since [our]343-us breakup [I]0-i ’ve second - guessed [myself]0-i countless times , continuously wondering whether [I]0-i should go to [the coffeeshop]344-the coffeeshop in hopes that [he]44-eric might be there , waiting for an explanation . Do n’t [you]0-i dare embarrass [me]148-my father tonight . ”[148-my father] [He]148-my father seems more anxious than usual , and [I]0-i ca n’t quite figure out why . [I]0-i perform at least once a month , and [I]0-i ’ve never failed [him]148-my father before — not with this . Playing the piano has always been [my]0-i escape . [I]0-i ’ve always found solace in the way [my]0-i fingers fly over the keys . A certain amount of control is required to play at the level [I]0-i ’ve mastered , and [I]0-i ’ve always taken pride in that . The only time [I]0-i truly feel in charge is when [I]0-i ’m performing . It ’s only then that [I]0-i ’m truly in [my]0-i element . [I]0-i might falter during practice , but never on stage , and [Father]38-father knows it . [The crowd]349-the crowd applauds , but the spotlight blinds [me]0-i to [them]349-the crowd . [I]0-i wonder if [they]349-the crowd realize that [they]349-the crowd ’re [the ones who maintain [my]0-i sanity]351-the ones who maintain my sanity . Without this , [I]0-i ’d drown in [my]0-i sorrows . [I]0-i lightly trace [my]0-i fingers over the ivories , [my]0-i mood mellowing . [My]0-i performances usually last an hour and a half , and [I]0-i always love every single second , because every one of those minutes is truly [mine]0-i . [I]0-i hope it ’s no different tonight . [I]0-i smile as [I]0-i decide to take a risk and veer off - course , playing something other than what [I]0-i ’m supposed to . Chapter Twenty - Three

[I]0-i ’ve been using [this house]2082-this house as an escape , telling [him]148-my father it was important [I]0-i finish decorating before [Dion]33-dion gets back , and the reprieve it ’s granted [me]0-i has been invaluable . In [[[my]0-i father]148-my father ’s house]849-my father ’s house , [I]0-i was n’t even allowed to pick the color of [my]0-i desk chair , but [I]0-i handpicked every last detail here , right down to the doorknobs . [I]0-i spent weeks ensuring everything was perfect , and [I]0-i felt like [I]0-i was truly in [my]0-i element . [I]0-i pause in [the living room]397-the living room , [my]0-i gaze settling on the grand piano by the window . [She]34-grandma told [me]0-i it ’s [Dion]33-dion ’s most prized possession , but it was so badly out of tune it was barely playable . Chapter Forty - One

Dion

[My]0-i body is taut with lingering tension from the flight as [I]0-i quietly slip into [the concert hall]1008-the concert hall , the sounds of [Faye]33-dion ’s performance the only thing disturbing the silence . [The only person who ever made [me]0-i [feel this in tune with music]1309-feel this in tune with music]1308-the only person who ever made me feel this in tune with music was [[my]0-i mother]144-my mother . [Dad]65-dad would be too . [He]65-dad firmly believed that [a man]259-a man should put [[his]259-a man wife]273-his wife and [family]382-family first , above business , above profit , above anything and everything else . - [Eric]44-eric .

Chapter Forty - Nine

Chapter Sixty - Two
